items.title: Introduction
desc: Notebook is a simple desktop application for taking notes.
It has five type of containers -
i) Heading
ii) List
iii) Textbox
iv) Table
v) Image
A notebook file ends with .nts file extension.
Create notebook file only using the Notebook application.
Platform : Windows(x64)

videos.caption: Create a Note
videos.desc: Video shows how to create a note file

items.title: Heading
desc: In this part we will learn how to work with headings.
We can align heading text into three types -
i) Left Align
ii) Center Align
iii) Right ALign
We can also give a border on the bottom of the heading.
For detailed information refer the below video(s).

items.title: Table
desc: Here we will learn how tables work.
Features :
] Add Column
] Add Row
] Delete Column
] Delete Row
The first row of the table will always be in bold because it is treated as column heading.

videos.caption: Example
videos.desc: Learn about heading in this video

items.title: Lists
desc: Lists makes our work neat.
Here we have two types of list -
i) Normal List or Unordered List
ii) Number List or Ordered List
We can also make nested lists
*To make a nested list Right Click over the list item to open the contextmenu.

videos.caption: Example
videos.desc: Get an in-depth overview on lists

items.title: Text
desc: Now we will work with normal text with a little bit of fun.
A simple text box is provided to write your content.
Text style is available here such as Bold, Italic, Underline.
Part of a text can be converted into a Pop-Up text.
You can style text by selecting the text and clicking the available buttons, or you can use the writing format.
In writring format you specify the required format and you get the desired result.
For Bold - use b:`this text will appear in bold in reading mode`
For Italic - use i:`this text will appear in italic in reading mode`
For Underline - use u:`this text will appear in underline in reading mode`
For PopUp - use p:`this text will appear in popup in reading mode`

items.title: Image
desc: An image can say a thousand words and we will see how notebook works with them.
We will learn how images can be intregated into the notebook.
The view has basic features like - Zoom, Rotate, Move.
